tweets.text: 100 shotgun opinions challenge thread: QUEER POLITICS https://t.co/Bwkgaq8kv5
1. It used to be easier to be a straight woman than to be a gay man, but now things have reversed and that goes to show just how much misogyny we still aren’t addressing
2. We won’t get positive queer representation in mass market media until publishing it in Russia doesn’t get you arrested and publishing it in China doesn’t get you censored

3. Saying anything about this stuff is a net bad play (even for a queer person) because the risk of unnecessary cancellation based on a mild misstatement mistake is enormous and I shouldn’t be doing this

4. Anti-queer sentiment often materializes as hatred of things that queer people use as safe spaces, because you can’t call people fags anymore but you can still make fun of burners or furries and it’s cool
5. The trans community put tons of work into getting queer political rights and cis gay men who stand aside apathetically when we could be returning the favor are goddamned monsters
6. Conservative types have not given up on ruining gay lives and if they win the fight on trans issues they will come for gay people again. Give them no quarter

7. Gay men who talk about how gross vaginas are need to shut the hell up because gay trans men exist and also because vaginas are pretty much built to feel good to have a penis inside so don’t knock it until you’ve tried it

8. Every queer subculture is approximately isomorphic to every other one and mostly meets the same identity validation needs as every other one so making fun of one you’re not in probably makes you a jerk

9. Gay kink spaces optimize for hotness at the occasional expense of consent/safety, pan kink spaces optimize for safety/consent at the occasional expense of hotness, neither of things is wrong or bad but it’s helpful to know that going in
10. Queer life is constantly figuring out how to balance privacy and providing representation against each other so that you help the next generation of queer kids without driving yourself insane
11. Gay men don’t lisp and wear pink because we like to, we do it because it reminds you not to express your shitty opinions around us for the sake of our own sanity
12. The sitting vice president of the US, if presented with a button he could press to kill every queer person on earth, would slam that shit in a heartbeat
13. If you’re disgusted by and afraid of gay people you are also gay, I don’t make the rules but it’s true. I’d say it’s 50/50 whether or not Mike Pence has blown a guy in an airport bathroom
14. Queer people are way better at having sex because we’ve actually had to think critically about what we want and how to get it.

15. Welcome To Night Vale is among the best queer representation in media because everything is very up front but also matter of fact and who cares anyway even there is a glow cloud raining dead animals on us right now
16. Ajani is Elspeth‘s gay best friend send tweet

17. I totally understand why women are generally wary of men’s motives but as a result many bisexual guys I know don’t often try to play with women because other men are very horny and simple in comparison. Something feels sad about this but there’s nothing clear to blame here

18. American Football is the most homoerotic sport on earth and I don’t understand how anyone convinced anyone else that it’s normal for straight men to wear tight clothes and tackle each other on TV every weekend
19. I have had many negative experiences with drunk straight women trying to get things from me by being hot and female and every time it goes terribly for everyone

20. It’s cool that gay men are more accepted now but and in some ways that means we don’t need queer specific spaces like gay bars as much anymore but they were important to my coming out and I think we’re losing something important when they disappear
21. Mayor Pete doing a Salvation army photo op is a betrayal of the gay community and demonstrates that he will do anything to be president. I do not trust him

22. The relentless “reading” and sniping culture that I see from some of the more glamorous gay types, which I think originally came from the drag world, is negative and horrible and I wish it would immediately disappear
23. Thor Ragnarok is the gayest Marvel movie but Guardians of the Galaxy is the queerest one
24. I know I’m supposed to like drag or whatever but something feels vaguely misogynistic or appropriative about it so I just don’t like being around it very much
25. Captain Marvel is obviously lesbian and even my straight Midwestern mom called that from miles away, we only don’t have this as text because of the previous China/Russia tweet

26. I really like “queer” as a word because choosing that as an identity leaves you room to figure out what your version of queer is. There’s such an established set of ways to be gay now and none of them spoke directly to me which made me feel lost for a while
27. If you can’t figure out how to use the pronouns someone wants you to, you’re an asshole
28. Most straight men will die without having had anyone massage their prostate and that is a goddamn shame, it feels soooooooo good but oh no don’t go in my butt that’s gay lol

29. There are massive geographic differences in how progressive gay culture in the midwest and gay culture on the west coast are and it matters a lot. I have heard gay men in Chicago say some stuff that would get you immediately cancelled in SF
30. Any queer person who votes republican is voting for politicians that would be happier if they were dead and should probably think about that for a while

31. I suspect that most hand-wringing about queer people ruining the world results from thinking that sexuality is a recurring problem that must be solved instead of a source of joy that should be explored
32. Gay men have an alcohol problem in general imo because the only public gathering spaces we’ve figured out how to sustain are bars
33. Poly/open relationships are more unstable than monogamous ones but also more interesting and it’s valid for someone else to sign up for that tradeoff even if you wouldn’t

34. When it comes to creating security and confidence in a queer identity there is no substitute for living in a major city with a thriving community for a year, but once you’ve done that once you kind of don’t need it anymore because your internal frame id strong enough

35. If you’re queer and don’t live somewhere that’s accepting of the ideal you, GET OUT OF THERE NOW there is no substitute for living somewhere that doesn’t require you to hide. Find a city and figure yourself out there, it’s much easier that way
36. The independent art scene is super queer because we don’t get the representation we want in mainstream media and we still want to make art anyway

37. I’ve heard straight people say that San Francisco is going to shit and they’re not wrong, but they’ll never understand the value it can have as a safe place to get grounded as a queer person and it will still be great for that for another five years or so.

38. Queer artists and craftspeople generally undercharge for their skill level because their queer customers are poor, which makes sense but leads to endemic commercial undervaluation of queer art. Buy queer art and tip well, you’re getting a deal
PrEP is great and all but wow are there a lot of STIs out there other than HIV that we should still avoid spreading and I hate how much American gays refuse to use condoms now
40. American gay bathhouse culture is slimy and disrespectful and masturbatory, European and Japanese bathhouses in comparison feel totally civilized to me
41. Straight people aren’t any less horny than queer people, we just talk about sex more than they do

42. Born This Way and You Need To Calm Down are too on the noise for queer people to like, that’s not our lived experience. Songs like Poker Face understand that there’s often still a little internalized shame in our heads about the identity no matter how much work we do
43. But I forgave Lady Gaga for Born This Way in my head when she did it at the Super Bowl because that’s exactly where I want a song like that if we have to have it

44. I wish the Tom of Finland crowd fetishized police officers way less. The police have never been our friends (see Stonewall Riots etc) and it’s only getting worse lately with mostly conservatives on power trips joining police forces.

45. I really enjoy how threatened some straight men feel around hypermasculine gay dudes compared to twinky mincing ones. Yeah we can look just like you except we bone guys instead, better not touch me or you’ll catch the gay too! Ooga booga etc

46. There are a lot of phrases in popular usage like “Wow that guy got fucked” and “oh stop sucking his dick man” that secretly demean women and queer people because only straight men don’t actually do those things and enjoy them unironically. Stop saying this stuff please

47. Many asexual people just haven’t found their thing yet. Many bisexual men just haven’t come around to accepting that they’re gay yet. But also many people actually are asexual or bisexual, and making jokes that they’re just in a phase is erasing and monstrous, don’t do that

48. In big cities it can be easy to get in a queer bubble where everyone you work with, are friends with, or romance is also queer, and you can have your ability to interact normally with non-queer society decay. This is seductive but usually bad for you in the end I think

49. I’ve met queer people who felt like they were constantly performing for everyone around them. I think that’s a natural response to a world that doesn’t have a default identity for you but it makes it a lot harder for friends to get close to you so maybe have an off switch?

50. Grade school and high school is the worst period of time in queer life and I’m relatively undamaged by it despite going to Catholic schools because I didn’t figure out I was gay until after college. I now consider this a great stroke of luck

51. We really don’t mind straight people at gay bars if you respect the space and behave yourself. I’ve seen screaming bachelorette parties do tourist runs through gay bars though and that’s just not ok
52. Old Town Road is a goddamned country song and it’s hilarious//depressing that the world had a conniption fit when a gay black man almost had the number one charting country hit
53. Openly queer people who aren’t white have Been Through Some Shit to get where they are and you’ll probably never fully appreciate how rough it was

54. I’m super not cool with men who fetishize the idea of “turning” straight men. You getting “have you tried not being gay” for years does not give you a license to “have you tried not being straight” someone else

55. The best queer coming out scene in all of cinema is the Blue Raja coming out as a superhero to his mom in Mystery Men. It’s coded very generally so it works for everybody, and Mom navigates it beautifully and supportively
56. As a species we have let tons of people in Africa die of AIDS because Republicans decided that HIV is the plague God made to kill all the gays, let them die, who cares about trying to cure it lol

57. Horny gay men behave just as callously towards potential sex targets as horny straight men, and often worse because fairly often they find another horny bad actor and get rewarded instead of being consistently slapped in the face every time
58. Gay dating apps are a hellscape and make everyone who uses them look at sex transactionally instead of connectively

59. Queer people in San Francisco are hyper-aware that they’re being gentrified out of the city, to the point that you can find “QUEERS HATE TECHIES” stencil-painted onto sidewalks. It makes being a rich queer person kinda weird

60 When non-rich queer people in SF figure out that you’re a rich queer person, they aggressively test you to find out if you are actually weird/subcultural/interesting enough that your presence is net positive. I’m not sure what would have happened to me if I had failed the test

61. Building queer people into game stories is really hard to push through gatekeepers because calling attention to unnecessary details is bad storytelling and character sexuality often doesn’t come up naturally.

62. My most successful trick to get it into games is to use queerness as a way to explain things that a character has already done, which is *good* storytelling because it fills in motivation holes and makes them more sympathetic overall

63. Ral Zarek is a great example imo. He’s protective of Ravnica at all costs despite being a planeswalker because there’s literally no other gay bars in the multiverse that he knows about, and he doesn’t care if Jace sometimes thinks he’s mean or whatever if he can save his home

64. If you can cast queerness as the only sympathetic way to explain a character you will often find success in pushing it through, though it would be nice if that didn’t result in so many bitter gay-coded villains :B

65. I know a surprising amount of gay firefighters, college or adult recreational football players, and military types who got into those things because they heavily fetishized those worlds and being in them for real is super horny. Don’t tell the republicans about this lol

66. Transitioning is a massively difficult and socially dangerous thing to do and anyone who thinks someone would do it just to get a minor advantage in some small arena has no clue what they’re talking about

67. The whole “men in women’s bathrooms” thing is known to be a fabrication of the right but it’s amazing to me that it stuck. Wouldn’t a male predator just go into a women’s bathroom as a dude not giving a shit? Seems much simpler to me

68. I’m a gay dude and I know a lot about that experience but there are tons of queer identities I know nothing about the lived experience of: trans, non-binary, lesbian, bisexual, ace all have tons of specific experiences I constantly learn about that are different from mine

69. I’m constantly frustrated by gay men who ask me if I’m a top or a bottom. I enjoy a diverse range of sex acts and being the receptive partner doesn’t mean that you can’t also have dominant energy at the same time so the words don’t even make sense

Also, nice

70. A lot of people I know think fisting is gross but I swear to you as far as I can tell it’s the most intensely pleasurable sexual experience available to people with penises. Straight men are just so damn skittish about butt stuff that 99.9% will never know
71. When I first came out, I didn’t have “queer” as a huge core part of my identity. The more radicalized I get, the more it feels front and center, but I would rather live in a world where it’s nbd

72. There’s a strange American obsession with people’s private sex lives that I think hits all people, not just queer folks. “why haven’t you had kids”, “who’s the woman in the couple”, and “have you had bottom surgery yet” all come from the same invasive impulse
73. I find the Japanese norm of “masturbate to or fuck whatever you want as long as you’re at home, it’s fine” quite civilized in comparison

74. Medieval Japan was “masturbate to or fuck whatever you want on your own time, just make sure you have kids to keep the family going”, which is also surprisingly reasonable for the 1500-1800 time period
75. WHY THE FUCK DID BATHROOMS EVER GET GENDERED JUST MAKE THEM ALL STALLS ALL THE TIME AAAAHHHHHHHH
76. All-gender bathroom signs that act like an all-gender bathroom is a funny joke can die in a grease fire. If you treat it like a joke you’re not normalizing it

77. As much as some people don’t like low-consequence queer character reveals in fiction like Soldier 76’s, I like normalizing the idea that sometimes someone you work with or know is queer but no big deal
78. fuck JK Rowling

79. The real reason trans people don’t exist in the Harry Potter universe is that TRANSFORMATION MAGIC LITERALLY EXISTS SO TRANSITION IS SUPER EASY, it’s nooo big deal to fix the body dysphoria, thanks for coming to my Ted talk
To be clear what I’m saying is that trans people exist and have used magic to look the way they want and no one has a problem with this
